page.title: 13St.James's Church 1
page.content: St.James's is a very old church, the oldest parts dating back to about 1006. The belfrey is approximately fifty metres tall and the steps are narrow and spiral. The organ is about one hundred years old (quite modern). There is a memorial for Lucy Kemp Welsh as well which was made by Mr. Charles Browne. It is made of stone and is a horse. There is a pulpit made of oak which has designs dating back to about 1600. The lectern is a brass eagle with a stand at the back where you put the book. The graves outside are quite old but the oldest of all is inside and belongs to Silus Titus Armg. The graveyard is very big, about 800 feet long. The royal family would come to the church and nominate the vicar. James Carter Bournehall JMI
